p: As COVID‐19 moved into Austin, TX, critical needs and problems hit our city and country like a hurricane: little personal protective equipment, no COVID‐19 testing, few ventilators, and the need to adapt to social distancing and stay‐at‐home orders. The onslaught of COVID‐19 shredded the functioning of our community, as new needs to adapt, work, live, relate to one another, and offer medical care was overwhelming.
